business.headline: Facebook owner Meta hit with 251 million euros in fines for 2018 data breachIreland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties to Meta after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code.

Cryptocurrencies to be taxed as capital gains: Relief for pre-FY23 earningsThe Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) decision defines cryptocurrencies as capital assets, distinguishing pre-2022 profits as capital gains and applying a 30% flat tax to post-2022 transactions.

Income Tax Department admits error of sending wrong ITR notices. Check details The Income Tax Department has acknowledged its mistake in sending defective ITR notices, offering relief to many, though taxpayers who filed revised returns could face complications.

Will India's economic growth pick up pace? Nirmala Sitharaman answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a 'temporary blip'.

Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.

Sensex plunges over 1,000 points as bearish sentiment grips marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1064.12 points to end the day at 80,684.45, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 332.25 points to close at 24,336.00.
EPFO members may soon approve their own PF withdrawals: ReportCurrently, withdrawing PF funds involves multiple checks and balances, with subscribers required to submit forms and wait for approvals.
EPFO high pension: Why have 1.7 million applied for higher EPS contribution?Launched in 1995, the Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS-95) offers social security to organised sector employees.

ITC shares rise as ITC Hotels demerger set for January 1, 2025: Key detailsITC Hotels demerger announcement came after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Kolkata Bench, approved the scheme of arrangement between ITC and ITC Hotels.

How big corporates are choking middle class, hurting India growth storyThe government gave tax relief to private companies in 2019 hoping they would invest in people and infrastructure. It was counterproductive. Big corporates pocketed profits and froze real wages of employees. Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.
Traffic challans in Delhi? Know how to get them waived off starting December 20Delhi Police launches Evening Court sessions from December 20 to clear pending traffic fines.

Dam Capital IPO: Check opening date, price band, gmp, issue details  DAM Capital Advisors' IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders.

Concord Enviro IPO opening date: Check GMP, price band, other detailsThe Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 500.33 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 0.25 crore shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.46 crore shares worth Rs 325.33 crore.

Sensex falls nearly 1,000 points: 3 key factors for the market crash todayShare market today: The S&P BSE Sensex fell by over 900 points to hit an intra-day low of 80,941.61, while theNSE Nifty50 dropped 247.75 points to reach its lowest point of the day at 24,420.5.

International Gemmological Institute IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status International Gemmological Institute IPO update: The International Gemmological IPO was fully booked on its final day of bidding.

Vishal Mega Mart share listing date: GMP jumps? Check if you got sharesVishal Mega Mart market debut: Investors who applied for the Rs 8,000 core IPO will receive alerts, messages, or emails regarding the allotment, or any revocations of their IPO mandate, by Tuesday, December 17.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade dragged by banking stocks; RIL shares down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 401.57 points to 81,347.00, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 109.30 points to 24,558.95.

Switzerland withdraws India's 'most favoured nation' status: 2 key impacts Switzerland will suspend the MFN clause in its DTAA with India starting January 1, 2025, increasing dividend taxes for Indian businesses operating in the country.
Work on weekends? This CEO expects employees to stay up past midnightKnown for her demanding schedule, Lisa Su often holds meetings at midnight and over weekends.

Billionaire blues for Ambani, Adani as networth slips below $100 billionReliance Industries, Mukesh Ambani's flagship company, has faced pressure in its core businesses. However, market analysts remain cautiously optimistic.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Your Constitution amendments vs ours: Amit Shah rips into CongressReplying to the debate on the Constitution in Rajya Sabha, Amit Shah compared BJP and Congress on Constitutional amendments, highlighting BJP's 22 modifications in 16 years versus Congress's 77 in 55 years.

Democracy at risk or step forward? Top lawyers weigh in on One Nation One PollIn separate interviews with India Today TV, Harish Salve and Abhishek Manu Singhvi gave their insights on the proposal of One Nation One Election, which is aimed at synchronising elections across India.

Binaca Geetmala was halted over Kishore Kumar-Indira Gandhi fallout: Amit ShahSharing his personal experience, Amit Shah recounted how Binaca Geetmala, the iconic radio show, was also disrupted during the Emergency, reflecting the then Indira Gandhi government's tightening grip on freedoms.

Relief to man accused of rape by his date, court flags 'dangers of dating apps'Karnataka High Court stayed proceedings against a 22-year-old man accused of raping a woman who he met through dating app Bumble.

Gabba Test: Why India were right in celebrating follow-on escape momentThe Indian dressing room broke into celebrations after the team avoided a follow-on on Day 4 of the Gabba Test against Australia. The jubilation drew mixed reactions from fans on social media, a section arguing that the team had gotten so bad that they were celebrating avoiding a follow-on.

Amit Shah taunts Rahul Gandhi: 54-year-old 'yuva' leader with Constitution copyUnion Home Minister Amit Shah, while replying to debate on the Constitution in Rajya Sabha, took a veiled dig at Rahul Gandhi and made reference to the Congress leader carrying a copy of the Constitution.

Grit, message and reward: KL Rahul's insider view of Akash-Bumrah Gabba heroicsAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: KL Rahul reflected on the emotions in the Indian dressing room after Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah's heroic last-wicket partnership helped them avoid the follow-on in Brisbane.

One Nation One Election bill be sent to Parliament panel, PM suggested: Amit ShahThe One Nation, One Election Bill was tabled in the Lok Sabha today (December 17), triggering protests from the opposition.

Why Pakistan has put over 4,300 beggars on no-fly listSeveral countries, including Saudi Arabia, warned Pakistan to stop exporting beggars. Now, Pakistan has placed 4,300 beggars on the Exit Control List, or no-fly list. The move is to prevent Pakistanis from misusing Umrah and Hajj visas for begging in Mecca and Medina.

Goa Chief Minister's wife files Rs 100-crore defamation case against Sanjay SinghAAP MP Sanjay Singh had recently addressed a press conference in Delhi where he allegedly made allegations against Sulakshana Sawant, the wife of Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant, in the cash-for-jobs scam.

Palestine yesterday, Bangladesh today: Priyanka Gandhi's bag in ParliamentPriyanka Gandhi, attending her maiden Parliament session after her recent election victory in Kerala's Wayanad, also raised her voice against the atrocities committed against minorities in Bangladesh during the Lok Sabha session on Monday.

How Indira Gandhi's 1970 decision was final nail in One Poll coffinIndia's democratic journey began with simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state Assemblies. The Congress-led Centre's dismissing of state governments decoupled elections in some states. However, it was Indira Gandhi's decision in 1970 that ended synchronised elections in India.

You've been misunderstanding Trauma Bonding all along. It's a toxic trapMany may assume trauma bonding is a positive bond shared over a past trauma, but you will be surprised that it is absolutely not what you think.

Voters are far wiser: Harish Salve rejects One Nation One Election criticismSenior advocate Harish Salve said simultaneous elections would prevent governance paralysis due to frequent polls and counter unaccounted money.

Omar Abdullah echoes Amit Shah on Congress and EVMsJust a day before Omar Abdullah set the cat among the pigeons by dismissing his ally Congress's objection to EVMs, Home Minister Amit Shah used a similar line of attack to deflate the opposition party's charge.

The Wright brothers' first flight: 12 seconds that took humanity to the skiesThe Wright brothers, Orville and Wilbur, spent years chasing a dream that seemed impossible. But on December 17, 1903, at 10:35 am, they made it possible with the first-ever human flight. Their 12-second flight covered only 120 feet but was a giant leap for humankind into the age of aviation.

Relive Mohan Bhargava's journey of homecoming as Swades completes 20 yearsAshutosh Gowariker's film Swades turned 20 today. The filmmaker shared a heartfelt letter celebrating the milestone on Instagram.

Kolkata bike-taxi rider barges into Thai woman's home, molests her; arrestedA Thai national residing in Kolkata for work was allegedly molested by an app-based bike rider in Kolkata's Salt Lake area on Sunday night. The accused was arrested.

The trailer of the documentary film offers a glimpse into the behind-the-scenes efforts that went into the making of the magnum opus and also covers its Oscars campaign.

Gabba Test: Coach Vettori admits Bumrah-Akash Deep stand foiled Australia's plans Australia assistant coach Daniel Vettori admitted that a gritty 39-run stand between Indian tailenders Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep foiled their plans to force a follow-on, while also justifying the decision not to declare the home team's first innings in the third Test, which appears to be heading for a draw.

Rahul explains his batting mantra in Australia: Tighten up defence in 30 oversVeteran India batter KL Rahul believes that tightening his defence and showing respect to the bowlers during the first 30 overs of an innings has been the key to his success in the ongoing series against Australia, where his teammates have largely struggled. Rahul has emerged as the most assured Indian batter on the tour, as he crafted a gritty 84 off 139 balls under challenging conditions, playing a crucial role in India's total of 252 for nine on day four of the third Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.
